basics.name: William Huey
basics.summary: Computer Science student at Cornell University interested in safe, interactive robotics

work.name: Research Associate
work.position: Cornell People and Robots Teaching and Learning Lab
work.summary: Imitation learning from videos under Prof. Sanjiban Choudhury
highlights: Discovered a novel approach for learning difficult robotic control tasks from a video
Achieved >4x improvement above existing baselines on 16 manipulation and humanoid control tasks in simulation
Presented at a CoRL 2024 workshop and submitted a first-author publication to a top ML conference (in review)

work.name: Software Engineering Intern
work.summary: Cloud infrastructure for packaging and builder tools
highlights: Deployed an AWS microservice to optimize software package storage, projected to save **$50M+** per year
Developed the application in Java and Typescript using ECS Fargate, DynamoDB, SQS, S3 event notifications, Cloudwatch metrics and alarms, and internal CI/CD pipelines
Collaborated with developers across multiple teams to identify key design choices
Wrote extensive unit, integration, and load tests that reflect actual customer request patterns

work.name: Research Intern
work.summary: Mobile robot traversability mapping under Prof. Marco Hutter and Prof. Donald Greenberg
highlights: Built a ROS package for mobile robot traversability mapping, resulting in a successful deployment on an ANYmal quadruped
Proposed a novel method to predict environment traversability given language constraints using VLMs
Distilled large VLMs into smaller visual networks capable of real-time traversability segmentation
Presented work at the Rawlings Cornell Research Scholarship Grand Slam, winning first prize of $500

work.name: Software Engineering Intern
work.summary: Combinatorial methods for flight control software verification
highlights: Developed a Python application to generate minimal test suites achieving high combinatorial coverage in state-based control systems
Identified unit tests improving combinatorial coverage of Starship HLS flight control software
Collaborated closely with NASA engineers and NIST researchers to evaluate integration testing procedures

awards.title: First Prize at Rawlings Cornell Research Scholarship Grand Slam

publications.name: Imitation Learning from a Single Temporally Misaligned Video
publications.publisher: In review at top ML conference
publications.summary: First-author publication (equal contribution with Huaxiaoyue Wang) on a novel approach for learning difficult robotic control tasks from video

publications.name: Time your rewards: Learning Temporally Consistent Rewards from a Single Video Demonstration
publications.publisher: CoRL 2024 Workshop on Whole-body Control and Bimanual Manipulation
publications.summary: Co-first-author publication (equal contribution with Huaxiaoyue Wang) presented at CoRL 2024 workshop
